turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: When you going to let me work with you?  Why you always fucking with me?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Why am I what?  Excuse me?  I catch you saying the F-word again.  I'll kill you.  That's a fucking promise.  Now get the fuck out of here.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I got something serious to dis-cuss.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Well what is it?  I'm not Kreskin.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Ouch.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Hey, you, get off my cloud.  I'm talking to my friend.  1962 Fender Stratocaster with original humbucking pick-ups, maple neck, strung upside down for a left- handed motherfucking genius... Jimi Hendrix.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Who cares?  I got a case.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Twelve pack?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: This ain't no social call.  One hundred bucks.  To find my father.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Did he just say what I think he said?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I've got a clue.  Look at my ring. Before my old lady ran off to Baja, she told me my dad had this same ring.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Holy Colonel Mustard.  Gosh, you didn't mention the big clue... Kid, I can't take your money.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: You need it.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I don't need it that bad.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Shut up, you dummy.  Who did this to you?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: These two guys in long cowboy coats and real nice suits.  I think Armani.  They were going through your stuff with screwdrivers and shit... I did what you would have done.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Run to the nearest phone and call the police.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Fuck that, I mean, the heck with that.  I kicked their ass!  Well, I tried.  There were two of them you know...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Jesus, how could you be so stupid?  Come on, we're going to a hospital.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: I tried to help you...!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: And hey, I appreciate it...

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Where's my father?  Have you even looked?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Yeah, uh, I got some pretty good leads...

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Liar!  You don't care!  About anything.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: So, did you find my dad?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Well, I got some good news and some bad news.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Yeah, go on...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Good news is that yeah, I found him.  The bad news is...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: It's me.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: What kind of sentimental bullshit is this?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Hey, I love you, too, you little jerk.  Jesus, guy tries to make a commitment and he's gotta eat shit.

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Who's my real father, man?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: He, he, lives in South America... he's doing that anthropologist- archeologist-dentist kind of thing ... he's real busy.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I need someone to help me with my case load, you interested?  This whole father/son thing, if you're not into it, I mean, it's okay. You know what I'm saying?

turns.speaker: THE KID
turns.text: Shut the heck up... Pop.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Nice tie, Lt. Anus, sir.

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: You think you're so hot just because you can get into any club. You think you're so hot, just because you have sex with great- looking women.  You think you're so hot just because you broke the Ensenada tape piracy ring...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You gotta admit those are all pretty great reasons...

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: Get the fuck out of here, honey... What do we got?

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: What are you running from?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Why shucks, Lt. Anus, you told me to get the fuck out of here...

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: If you're hiding something... oh, oh, I'll have so much fun.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Why do you hate me?  It's gotta be more than Me Private You, You Cop.

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: Two words.  Disco Express.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Disco Ex -- man, that group sucked like a squid, they had some shitty single they wanted me to plug, back in my publicist days...

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: 'Booty Time.'

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Yeah, and that lead singer, Jesus, that white Van McCoy wanna-be with the six-inch platform shoes. He looked...

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: Like me.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I was about to say he looked like shit, but hey, sure, he looked like you.

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: 'It's booty time, it's booty time, across the U.S.A.  It's booty time...'

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You were the lead sing -- Lieutenant, I didn't think anyone could cheer me up tonight... Thanks.  Really.

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: Have a problem, call Ford Fairlane.  He won't solve your case, but who cares, you'll be dead in a couple days anyway. Let's face it.  After today, the California Raisins aren't gonna hire you.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: That's okay.  I'm quitting the music detective business to become a cop killer.  Pay's the same, but it'll be much more fun.

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: God, I wish I could prove you killed everybody.  Unfortunately, I know who the real killer is.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: It's some psycho killer groupie. I got an anonymous letter that says she killed Bobby Vomit, Johnny Crunch, and now, this society dame.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Once I got an anonymous letter saying that the world would be destroyed by a giant purple raindrop. I didn't even buy a fucking umbrella... You were in too many discos during the seventies.  The Village People rotted your brain.

turns.speaker: LT. AMOS
turns.text: That's the difference between a great investigator like me and a piece of Spam like you.  You look at this picture and all you see is beauty.  I see the beast.

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: Polo.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Whatever you're getting paid, I can give you twenty, maybe thirty bucks more.

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: Feel my thumb?  I keep it there forty seconds more and a welt develops cutting off the oxygen to your brain.  I leave.  Twenty- one minutes later, you're dead. The slowest, most painful minutes a person can experience.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I guess you never saw 'A Very Brady Christmas.'

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: Case closed, okay?  Thirty seconds.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Fine!

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: What's fine?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I'm off it!

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: Off what?  Twenty seconds...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: The case!

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: Oh.  One more thing.  This is personal.  I want you to tell me you're a big sissy.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: <u>I.  Am.  The.  Biggest.  Sissy.</u> <u>In.  The.  Whole.  Fucking.  World</u>.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You were saying, snapperhead?  I'll bet you're not smiling now!

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: Oh, but I am.  Dianetics, Ford.  You should try it.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Say cheese...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I want you to say that you're the biggest sissy in the whole wide world.

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: <u>I'm.  The.  Biggest.  Sissy.  In</u>. <u>The.  Wide.  World</u>.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Okay.  'B-y-e!

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: How's it going?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You gotta be kidding!  This is unfuckingbelievable!  I have to start the evening crawling down Capital Records, I shoulda chose suicide then, but oh no, the night was young!  Next up, my guitar! The second most important thing I own and now it's toothpicks for the homeless on Hollywood Boulevard!  Then, then, after I burned up your brother, Jazz... I should say as a fucking footnote I've usually treated women like shit -- used corsages, the wet spot, you know giving out Domino's Pizza's phone number and saying it's mine... Tonight was different. I felt respect.  I felt love.  Then Jazz left me... and <u>now</u> I get to die!

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: The point?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Let me go out like a man.

turns.speaker: SMILEY
turns.text: Anyway you want it, asshole.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: How could Grendel Records sign such a wick-prick?  I guess Julian Grendel really is deaf as a fucking doorknob.  I hear Ray Charles is going to head up the video division.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Actually that's rather an intriguing idea...

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Good to meet you, Mr. Fairlane. Your mouth makes quite a reflection.  I'm Julian Grendel.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Boing.  You're one hell of a lip reader.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Why thank you.  It's a Christmas present.  That was my sense of humor, everyone.  I wish you would fake a laugh.  It's easy with a deaf person.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I knew your father.  He was quite...

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: An asshole?  A swine?  A ballistic turd?  Pick one.  I never knew what a blessing my accident was until he died and I had to take over the company.  You see the music is irrelevant in this industry.  I'm going to have to ship this 'wick-prick' platinum just so teenage girls can have a compact disc cover to get wet with.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Terrible thing, but good career move.  His record sales have gone way up.  I'll just have to create a new Black Vomit.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I was just discussing this whole Vomit thing with my friend Art Mooney.  Do you know him?

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Well, hello, Ford.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Mmmmmmm.  Mmmm, mmm.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: I must say you're an island of reality in an ocean of diarrhea.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: So what did you think of the ballet? Was it like a warm Ice Capades?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Yeah, I did, you condescending fuck, but I miss Snoopy coming out at the end.  Isn't your enjoyment impaired?

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Don't worry I can run every ballet note for note in my brain...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Jazz, we're talking here.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Go on, another time, another place.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Uh, nice piano.  Probably get a lot of complaints from the neighbors -- heh...  It's another time, Julian, another place.  If I told you Bobby Vomit, Johnny Crunch, and Colleen Sutton were the ones you were complaining about, the ones who tried to rip you off, what would your reaction be?

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Shock.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: And if I told you that you already knew all that shit, and that you had them killed, what would you do then?

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Golly, I'd probably faint.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Actually you're a bit off in the motivation department... I mean, revenge is so... Bronson.  Wait, where's the third C.D.?  How could you come here without proof? It's a three piece set here!  A computer disc from Colleen, Bobby's computer disc, and Johnny's computer disc.  Together they make, oh fucking forget it!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, I know the third one unscrambles the high bits and the low bits.  Shit, just start torturing me, man.  I didn't even know Johnny had a disc and I can't deal with any 'Don't play games with me, Mr. Fairlane' bullshit.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Don't play games... ugh.  Did you say you don't have the third... ugh.  I'm not going to torture <u>you</u>, Ford.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: It doesn't have to be like this?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Oh God, please, <u>don't</u>!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: <u>Okay</u>!  Okay.  You got me.  Boy, you guys are tough.  I have the third disc.  Indeed.  I.  Do. Yes, sir.  Yeah you assholes, it's in a very safe place with instructions to have it sent directly to the police if I don't make a phone call by seven o'clock.  So if you'll excuse us...

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: It's 7:30.  You really should get a watch.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Ah, I didn't say seven <u>P</u>.M., now did I?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I just gave up smoking.  A last drink?

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: I'm running a little late.  You see, I'm having a party at <u>THE</u> Club to introduce the new lead singer for Black Vomit.  Everyone in the industry will be there, including our friend, Don Cleveland.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: What about Don?

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Before Black Vomit starts its set, Don will have his head blown off. The papers next week will reveal that he was partners with Bobby, Johnny, and Collie in 'the Grendel Records scam.'  He killed them to pay off a debt to 'the mob' or something lame like that.  And then the mob iced him.  It's all more tasteful than it sounds.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Kill them.  Not quickly.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: When I say 'no,' run for the door.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Oh, wait.  One sec.  Open the window.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Ciao.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You'd said something about proof...

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Oh please, Ford, I'll do any --

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: And may I suggest for dessert, the five copies I made...

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Fuck me...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Maybe later, but first I want like to know why you'd steal from your own company...

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: When I was young, I read <u>Billboard</u> and I could not believe how much Grendel Records and how little of it my idiot father Old Jack Grendel got.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty amazing how much cash you gotta give to the actual artists who create the music.  Those ingrates really take a bite.  But seriously, when Pops died, you got Vomit, Crunch, and Sutton to help finance a C.D. Cleans operation. You got greedy and they tried to get the three discs together to threaten you, but...

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: What is this, are you holding a microphone behind my head?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Man, Julian, that accident took away more than your hearing.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: Accident?  Accident!  You naive pussball, when I realized my life of music could only be a life of music industry.  I <u>cut my fucking</u> <u>ears off</u> so I'd only hear <u>my</u> music. Here, look.

turns.speaker: GRENDEL
turns.text: I'm still the king!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Julian, you're fired.

turns.speaker: MELODI
turns.text: You're that guy, the private eye.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: You're a poet and didn't know it.

turns.speaker: MELODI
turns.text: Do you really know everybody in the industry?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Only on a first name basis.

turns.speaker: MELODI
turns.text: That's cute.  You're funny.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: That's funny, you're cute.

turns.speaker: MELODI
turns.text: You heard that Bobby Vomit O.D.'d, right?  Do you suspect foul play and stuff?

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I'll tell you when somebody pays me to give a shit and stuff.

turns.speaker: MELODI
turns.text: Hi, private eye guy!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Hey, the poet...

turns.speaker: MELODI
turns.text: Hey, troops, here's that rock 'n' roll detective I told you about.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Hebedeebuh.  Hebedeebuh.  Maybe I did die in the explosion.

turns.speaker: MELODI
turns.text: This isn't music!

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: It is to us!  It's computerised.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I don't believe it.  Getting paid to be the asshole you always were.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Fucking amazing, huh?  Chevy Nova, you Bensonhurst shit!  Still in La-la land.  Look at us, two rock 'n' roll dicks.  Unfortunately, only one of us is a detective.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Nice getting all those phone calls from you after you hit it big, you Redhook bastard.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I don't remember any Arbor Day cards from Mr. Rock 'n' Roll Detective.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Friendship's a lot different out here.  A wrong number is a relationship.  But then this isn't a social call.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: How nice.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: It's my daughter, man.  I know I never told you about her, but God, I love that girl.  She calls herself Zuzu Petals and she's been swallowed up by the gorgeous hell that is L.A. A fucking groupie partying with the pros.  You have to get my baby back, she's my pride and --

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: 'Bye, Johnny...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: So...

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: I don't take cases with foundations in bullshit.  They are very hard to walk around in.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Just find her, man.  She's my daughter, she's my sister, she's my mother, she's some little brat I stood in line with at Taco Bell last week.  Do whatever you want with my words.  And my money.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I am told it is difficult to pay the phone bill with gold chains and V.C.R.s.  There's four thousand here.

turns.speaker: FORD
turns.text: Zuzu Petals.  Sounds like a drug. A lethal one.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I hope you solve the case and I know you will, because you're the best.  Ford, guys like you don't grow on trees.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What's my name?

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Doyle.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: Mr. Doyle.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Ever pick your feet in Poughkeepsie?

turns.speaker: 1ST MAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What about you?  Can you stand a toss?

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: I'm clean.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: You don't use shit?

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Did I say you could move that hand -- I'm not gonna get stuck am I?

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: No - no.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Cause if I do.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: How's everything?

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: Everything is everything.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: How come there's nothing out there? That stuff is all milk.

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: There's nothing around.  Nobody's holding.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I got a name - Sal Boca, Brooklyn.

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: Boca?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: B.O.C.A.

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: Doesn't register.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Got a wife named Angie.

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: No, nothing.  There's only some talk.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: Coming in this week, week after. Everybody going to get well.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Who brings it?

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: Who knows?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Where do you want it?

turns.speaker: 2ND MAN
turns.text: This side.

turns.speaker: ANGIE
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Takin' care o' business, honey.

turns.speaker: ANGIE
turns.text: Takin' care o' business -- it's after midnight.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You know I hadda meet some people tonight --

turns.speaker: ANGIE
turns.text: -- Well finish all your meetin' people and get back here now -- and bring a pizza with you.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Where'm I goinna get a pizza this time o' night?

turns.speaker: ANGIE
turns.text: Well try, okay?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I don't know where I'm gonna find a pizza joint open.

turns.speaker: ANGIE
turns.text: Sal --

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: ANGIE
turns.text: Don't forget anchovies.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What's your name, asshole?

turns.speaker: BLACK PUSHER
turns.text: Fuck you, Santa Claus!

turns.speaker: BLACK PUSHER
turns.text: I don't...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Ever pick your feet in Poughkeepsie?

turns.speaker: BLACK PUSHER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Did you ever pick your feet in Poughkeepsie?

turns.speaker: BLACK PUSHER
turns.text: I don't know what you're talkin' about.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Were you ever in Poughkeepsie?

turns.speaker: BLACK PUSHER
turns.text: No... yeah...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Did you ever sit on the edge of the bed, take off your socks and stick your fingers between your toes?

turns.speaker: BLACK PUSHER
turns.text: Man, I'm clean.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: You made three sales to your roaches back there.  We had to chase you through all this shit and you tell me you're clean?

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Henri c'est gentil d'être venu.  Je vous présente mon associé, Pierre Nicoli.  Henri Devereaux.

turns.speaker: DEVEREAUX
turns.text: Enchanté.  Alain, j'ai réfléchi à votre proposition et j'ai décidé d'accepter.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Did you pick up the car?

turns.speaker: DEVEREAUX
turns.text: It is waiting for you in the garage.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Did they follow you?

turns.speaker: DEVEREAUX
turns.text: I wasn't looking.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Henri... I need one more favor from you.  I know I am imposing...

turns.speaker: DEVEREAUX
turns.text: My friend, I am not sure about what is going on -- but for me, I am finished.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Not quite -- you are in it whether you like it or not.  The police know you brought the car into the country.  This makes you an accomplice.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Calm down -- Henri!  You must trust me -- this is an extremely complicated situation to which there is a simple solution if you do exactly what I tell you.  It's worth more money to you.

turns.speaker: DEVEREAUX
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Allo... Salvatore...

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Who's this --

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: ... Salvatore?...

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Twelve o'clock... yes...

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Yes --

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Everything's smooth.  Beautiful.  I will need a few more days though, the boys think we oughta cool it for awhile -- make sure there's no heat.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: You must take me for an imbecile. Why do you think I asked you to meet me in Washington?  I haven't spent five minutes in New York City without the company of a gendarme.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Look, I'll level with you -- I need a little more time -- I got to shift gears.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Are you having trouble raising the half million?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Hell no -- my end is covered -- my associates just feel we ought to wait for a more opportune time to make the switch.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: It has to be by the end of this week.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Look, Mr. Charnier, you got to be reasonable.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: It's your problem.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: It's yours too!

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Tu sais j'ai réfléchi longuement à ton cadeau pour le voyage.  Je l'ai choisi moi-même.  Tiens.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Je peux l'ouvrir tout de suite?

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Si tu veux.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Oh Alain!  C'est merveilleux!  Tu me gâtes.  Je t'aime.  Attends, je vais te montrer moi aussi ce que j'ai acheté.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Encore du sho ping!

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Regarde mon pêcheur de baleine... Tu sais il va faire très froid cet hiver.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Avec ça tu pourras le supporter.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Mais non, c'est pour toi.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Pour moi?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Regarde, il te va parfaitement bien!

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Formidable!  Sans toi je m'habillerais encore en docker.  Je suis passé voir Françoise.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Comment va-t-elle?

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Je n'ai jamais vu tant de sérenité. Elle m'a demandé de tes nouvelles et si nous étions heureux.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Le sommes nous?

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Non!

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Alain is the only man I know who can become as enthusiastic about a bridge as he can about a woman.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Not any woman, Marie.  Just one.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Are you sure it is dead?

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: I'm going to put them on the cat.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: That's a relief.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Sale boulot.

turns.speaker: NICOLI
turns.text: Il fallait le faire.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Il est en retard.

turns.speaker: NICOLI
turns.text: Je crois qu'on fait une erreur de le prendre avec nous.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Une erreur!  C'est génial.  C'est une vedette à la télévision.  Il peut aller partout sans être soupçonné... En plus il a besoin de fric.

turns.speaker: NICOLI
turns.text: J'ai pas confiance en lui.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Sois gentil avec lui.  On ne sait jamais.  Il peut te faire travailler à la télévision.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: I'm afraid they've become a bit... over-cautious.  Our American friends.

turns.speaker: NICOLI
turns.text: What happens to the schedule?

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: We must follow it.

turns.speaker: NICOLI
turns.text: But will they?

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: I don't know.  Boca is scared. He's not strong enough.  He sees policemen in his soup.

turns.speaker: NICOLI
turns.text: He is not wrong.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Mmmmm.  That bastard who followed me on the subway, he's the eager one.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: There'll be someone else.

turns.speaker: NICOLI
turns.text: What difference does it make? We'll be out of the country Friday.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: It's beautiful.

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: It was built in 1917 - and was one of the two heaviest bridges in the world.  The arch is still the largest in the world.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Who financed it?

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: If this bridge were in Europe, it would be on every tourist's sight- seeing list.

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: Most New Yorkers never notice it - most Americans have never heard of it.

turns.speaker: CHARNIER
turns.text: Look how gracefully they conceived that arch.  Like a bowstring.  It was built from both ends.  With no support in the middle.  Beautiful.

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: Mmm.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: What's your story?

turns.speaker: DANCER
turns.text: Gimme a break, Mr. Russo.  I'm in show business.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: You're in show business.

turns.speaker: DANCER
turns.text: S'right.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: All right, get up on that bar and dance.

turns.speaker: DANCER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Get up on the bar and show me how you work.  If I like it you don't have to go in.

turns.speaker: DANCER
turns.text: You're for real?

turns.speaker: DANCER
turns.text: I got no music!

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Fake it.

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: I'm sorry, I don't know who you mean.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: He got off on six.

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: We have four rooms and six suites on six.  There's a man in almost every one of them.

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: There's nobody like that on six.

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: Perhaps he's visiting a guest.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: No, I figure he stays here.  Where's your registration?

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: There may be two... no, three who could fit it.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Names.

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: A Mr. Paul Ganapolos, he's here alone.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Where from?

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: Des Moines.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What's he do?

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: Businessman.  Owns a department store in Des Moines, I think.

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: Mr. and Mrs. Alain Charnier, would be another.  He's in shipping.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Yeh?  Who else?

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: And a Mr. Michael Lowenstein, I don't know what he does.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: This Charnier guy.  He's in shipping?

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: I think so.  But they're in Room 408.  On the fourth floor.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Where's he from?

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: Marseilles.

turns.speaker: DESK CLERK
turns.text: That's in France.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: MUTCHIE
turns.text: What about you, Doyle?  Who's the best fighter you ever seen?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Willie Mays.

turns.speaker: MUTCHIE
turns.text: What ya doin' out so late?  Hidin' from the cops?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I hear the health department is going to close this joint for selling dirty beer.  I come by to help you carry out your money.

turns.speaker: MUTCHIE
turns.text: They'll close you down if they ever get a look at those busted-valise broads you run with.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: You want some eggs.

turns.speaker: MUTCHIE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Hey, Mutch!  You want bacon?

turns.speaker: MUTCHIE
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Where the hell is it?

turns.speaker: MUTCHIE
turns.text: Where the hell do you think it is, potato head?

turns.speaker: MUTCHIE
turns.text: I got this little chick I'm tryin' to hit on.  She's about 20, 21... I take her to Jilly's last night and she's tellin' me about how she wants to settle down one day, get married... I says, "Hey, this is 1971, baby, I'm just a dirty old man lookin' to score with some pussy."

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Strike out, eh?

turns.speaker: MUTCHIE
turns.text: Yeah.  In the late innings.  Ya look like a night's sleep wouldn't kill ya.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: A piece of ass wouldn't kill me.

turns.speaker: MUTCHIE
turns.text: When ya go back on?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Morning.  Sometime.

turns.speaker: MUTCHIE
turns.text: Whyn't ya stretch out on the pool table for a couple hours.  The kid comes in at six will wake ya.  A couple eggs and a beer is cheaper than keepin' a dog around the joint.

turns.speaker: MULDERIG
turns.text: Christ you should o' collared him right there.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Who's on him?

turns.speaker: MULDERIG
turns.text: Why don't you do the same, Doyle? You look like shit.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Look.  My partner and I found this case and I don't want no Feds screwing it up.

turns.speaker: MULDERIG
turns.text: Case?  So far I haven't seen a damn thing.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Bill, keep shootin' your mouth off and I'll knock you into the middle of next week.

turns.speaker: MULDERIG
turns.text: Yeah, we got the Westbury covered like a tent.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: The Westbury?  Balls.  I got him down at the subway at Times Square. What the hell's goin' on?  I make him coming right out of the hotel free as a bird.  Not a soul awake.

turns.speaker: MULDERIG
turns.text: That's crazy.  You lost the Frog in the subway and you blew our cover. If they haven't moved already they're not gonna move now.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Walter, I can make this case if the Feds will get the hell out of my way.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: A bunch of lousy little spic car thieves.

turns.speaker: MULDERIG
turns.text: Nothing in there except a New York street map.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Tumble it.  One end to the other.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Who stuck up the laundromat?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: How about that time you were picking your feet in Poughkeepsie?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Havin' trouble?  You're a dumb guinea.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: How'd I know he had a knife.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Never trust a nigger.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: He coulda been white.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Never trust anybody.  You goin' sick?

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Not a chance.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Let's popeye around the Chez for a half hour, catch the end of the show and a couple drinks.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Some other time Jimmy, I'm beat.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Come on -- one drink.  Whatta you say?

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Drink this.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Whip it out.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I make at least two junk connections at that table in the corner.  The guy is the stripe combo, I know him too.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Hey, I thought we come for a drink.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Who is that guy?

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Policy man in Queens.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What about the last of the big-time spenders.  You make him?
